sub_topic: Identifying the clique number of a graph.
message_1: Consider a graph with 7 vertices and the following edges: AB, AC, BC, BD, CD, DE, and EF. What is the clique number of this graph?
message_2:
The clique number of a graph is the size of the largest complete subgraph (i.e., a subgraph in which every pair of vertices is connected by an edge).

Let's analyze the given graph:

Vertices: A, B, C, D, E, F, G (7 vertices)
Edges: AB, AC, BC, BD, CD, DE, EF (7 edges)

We can see that there is a complete subgraph with vertices A, B, and C, as all three vertices are connected to each other (AB, AC, BC). There is no larger complete subgraph in this graph.

Therefore, the clique number of this graph is 3.
